subject: Snowmobiles
Accidents and Safety
lead_paragraph: The picturesque forested trail that runs past Otter Lake and Long Lake on the southern edge of the Adirondacks near Woodgate, N.Y., has been the location for the deaths of three snowmobilers over five days. Over all, the recent spate of snowmobile fatalities in Oneida County — a total of four deaths in nine days — pushed the number of people killed in snowmobiling accidents this winter in New York to 18. That put the state on pace for its deadliest sledding season since 31 riders died in 2002-3, according to the state Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation.The most recent accident was late Monday or early Tuesday when 22-year-old Craig Albert crashed into a stand of trees about a half-mile from where two of his friends were killed over the weekend.
